availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas P. Roberts (Pendleton County, KY, laborer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, laborer. Campbell County, Kentucky, native. Married to Elizabeth Lovelace Roberts in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on June 15, 1856. Father of Ida M. Roberts, Julia F. Roberts, and Thomas M. Roberts. Laborer in Boone County in 1850. Day laborer in Kenton County, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 146A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, District 1, p. 490.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct 1, p. 390A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Film #994052: Pendleton County Marriages, 1852-1859, p. 7 of 20 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, “Thomas Piner Roberts (1830-1891)," Memorial # 75623184, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/75623184/thomas-piner-roberts (accessed April 8, 2021).
